required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate (SFP) in Dialysate in CKD Patients Receiving Chronic Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blinded, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover, Multicenter Phase III Safety Study of Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate (SFP) in Dialysate in Chronic Kidney Disease Patients Receiving Chronic Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the parent study is to assess the short-term safety and tolerability of soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) in dialysate administered to a large number of representative adult chronic kidney disease patients on hemodialysis (CKD-HD).
The purpose of the extension study is to assess the long-term safety and tolerability of SFP.

detailed_description.textblock:
Parent Study: randomized, double-blinded, crossover, up to 6 weeks, 700 patients. Patients were randomized to receive SFP 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate in liquid bicarbonate concentrate or placebo (standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate) x 2 weeks, then a 1 week washout, then crossed over to the alternate treatment x 2 weeks.
Extension Study: open-label, single active arm, uncontrolled study, up to 53 weeks, 300 patients. Following completion of the RMTI-SFP-6 parent study, patients could enter the extension study, where they received SFP 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate in liquid bicarbonate concentrate for up to 52 weeks.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-emergent Adverse Events of Intradialytic Hypotension
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. For each adverse event, investigators assessed whether the event met the protocol criteria for intradialytic hypotension. Intradialytic hypotension events were only to have been reported as adverse events if they exceeded the individual subject's baseline pattern of intradialytic hypotension.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Related Suspected Hypersensitivity Reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. For each adverse event, investigators assessed whether the event met protocol criteria for suspected hypersensitivity reactions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. Adverse event terms meeting criteria for composite cardiovascular events were pre-specified in the statistical analysis plan for the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Hemodialysis Vascular Access Thrombotic Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. Adverse event terms meeting criteria for hemodialysis vascular access thrombotic events were pre-specified in the statistical analysis plan for the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. Adverse event terms meeting criteria for other thrombotic events were pre-specified in the statistical analysis plan for the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. Adverse events of systemic/serious infections were defined in the statistical analysis plan for the study to include infections for which the subject was administered at least 3 doses of an IV antibiotic, and infections for which the subject was hospitalized.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. For each adverse event, investigators assessed whether the event met seriousness criteria.

other_outcome.measure: Serum Iron Change From Pre-dialysis to Post-dialysis at Week 2
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dialysis and post-dialysis during study week 2 of the Parent (Crossover) Study
other_outcome.description: Serum iron was assessed from samples obtained pre-dialysis and post-dialysis at a single hemodialysis during study week 2. Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 2 values reflect effects of SFP in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of Placebo in the Placebo/SFP arm.

other_outcome.measure: Serum Iron Change From Pre-dialysis to Post-dialysis at Week 5
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dialysis and post-dialysis during study week 5 of the Parent (Crossover) Study
other_outcome.description: Serum iron was assessed from samples obtained pre-dialysis and post-dialysis at a single hemodialysis during study week 5. Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 5 values reflect effects of Placebo in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of SFP in the Placebo/SFP arm.

other_outcome.measure: Unsaturated Iron-binding Capacity Change From Pre-dialysis to Post-dialysis at Week 2
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dialysis and post-dialysis during study week 2 of the Parent (Crossover) Study
other_outcome.description: Unsaturated iron-binding capacity was assessed from samples obtained pre-dialysis and post-dialysis at a single hemodialysis during study week 2. Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 2 values reflect effects of SFP in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of Placebo in the Placebo/SFP arm.

other_outcome.measure: Unsaturated Iron-binding Capacity Change From Pre-dialysis to Post-dialysis at Week 5
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dialysis and post-dialysis during study week 5 of the Parent (Crossover) Study
other_outcome.description: Unsaturated iron-binding capacity was assessed from samples obtained pre-dialysis and post-dialysis at a single hemodialysis during study week 5. Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 5 values reflect effects of Placebo in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of SFP in the Placebo/SFP arm.

other_outcome.measure: Transferrin Saturation Change From Pre-dialysis to Post-dialysis at Week 2
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dialysis and post-dialysis during study week 2 of the Parent (Crossover) Study
other_outcome.description: Transferrin saturation (based on TIBC derived from transferrin levels) was assessed from samples obtained pre-dialysis and post-dialysis at a single hemodialysis during study week 2. Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 2 values reflect effects of SFP in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of Placebo in the Placebo/SFP arm.

other_outcome.measure: Transferrin Saturation Change From Pre-dialysis to Post-dialysis at Week 5
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dialysis and post-dialysis during study week 5 of the Parent (Crossover) Study
other_outcome.description: Transferrin saturation (based on TIBC derived from transferrin levels) was assessed from samples obtained pre-dialysis and post-dialysis at a single hemodialysis during study week 5. Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 5 values reflect effects of Placebo in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of SFP in the Placebo/SFP arm.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
other_outcome.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis ferritin levels were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to determine whether soluble ferric pyrophosphate increases iron stores.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
other_outcome.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis serum iron levels were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to determine the effect of soluble ferric pyrophosphate on serum iron.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
other_outcome.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis transferrin saturation were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to confirm clearance of iron derived from soluble ferric pyrophosphate.

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of Patients Meeting Hy's Law Criteria
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
other_outcome.description: The peak alanine aminotransferase and the peak total bilirubin levels were evaluated per patient. Laboratory values for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. Patients with alanine aminotransferase more than three times the upper limit of normal and also total bilirubin more than two times the upper limit of normal are counted.

arm_group.description: Soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate in liquid bicarbonate concentrate x 2 weeks, then 1 week washout, then standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without SFP x 2 weeks

Standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without SFP x 2 weeks, then 1 week washout, then soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate in liquid bicarbonate concentrate x 2 weeks.

intervention.description: Dialysis with SFP administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate at a concentration of 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate
Dialysis with standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without iron

criteria.textblock:
Parent Study, Double Blinded, Crossover:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult ≥ 18 years of age.
2. Has chronic kidney disease (CKD) receiving maintenance hemodialysis (HD) (CKD-HD subjects) and regularly undergoing 2 or more dialysis sessions per week.
3. Stable pre-dialysis Hgb ≥ 9.0 to ≤ 12.5 g/dL.
4. Stable pre-dialysis TSAT ≥ 15% to ≤ 45%.
5. Stable pre-dialysis ferritin ≥ 100 to ≤ 1200 µg/L (1200 ng/mL).
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any previous exposure to SFP.
2. Therapy with intravenous, intramuscular or oral iron at any time between the first/screening visit and the randomization visit, or anticipated requirement for iron supplementation during the study period.
3. Non-tunneled vascular catheter for dialysis.
4. Scheduled for kidney transplant within the next 8 weeks.
5. Active infection requiring systemic antimicrobial or antifungal therapy within 2 weeks prior to screening, or during screening period prior to randomization.
6. Hospitalization within 1 month prior to screening (except for vascular access surgery).
Extension Study, Open Label, Single Active Arm:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participated in Parent Study RMTI-SFP-6 and completed the follow-up/early term visit.
2. Hemoglobin ≤12.0 g/dL at screening.
3. TSAT ≤45% at screening. (Excursion of TSAT by ≤10% outside this range permitted only if all other inclusion/exclusion criteria are met).
4. Serum ferritin ≤1000 µg/L at screening. (Excursion of ferritin by ≤10% outside this range permitted only if all other inclusion/exclusion criteria are met).
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Had a serious adverse event attributable (i.e., probably, possibly, or definitely related) to study drug or had an adverse event attributable to study drug that necessitated premature withdrawal from the double-blind, placebo-controlled crossover phase of the parent study RMTI-SFP-6.
2. Non-tunneled vascular catheter for dialysis.
3. Scheduled for kidney transplant within 12 weeks after entry into extension phase.
4. Active infection requiring systemic antimicrobial or antifungal therapy within 2 weeks prior to dosing.
5. Pregnancy or intention to become pregnant during the study.

group.title: SFP/Placebo
group.description: Soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate in liquid bicarbonate concentrate x 2 weeks, then 1 week washout, then standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without SFP x 2 weeks

group.title: Placebo/SFP
group.description: Standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without SFP x 2 weeks, then 1 week washout, then soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate in liquid bicarbonate concentrate x 2 weeks.

participants_list.participants: One patient completed the treatment period but discontinued prior to completing the follow-up visit.

baseline.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.description: Soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) 2 µM (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate in liquid bicarbonate concentrate x 2 weeks, then 1 week washout, then standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without SFP x 2 weeks

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.description: Adverse events for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention.

Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 2 values reflect effects of SFP in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of Placebo in the Placebo/SFP arm.

outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

group.title: SFP/Placebo
group.description: Parent Study: Blinded soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate, then 1 week washout, then blinded standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without SFP x 2 weeks SFP: Dialysis with SFP administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate at a concentration of 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate Placebo: Dialysis with standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without iron

group.title: Placebo/SFP
group.description: Parent Study: Blinded standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without SFP x 2 weeks, then 1 week washout, then soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate x 2 weeks. SFP: Dialysis with SFP administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate at a concentration of 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate Placebo: Dialysis with standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without iron

measure.title: Unsaturated Iron-binding Capacity Change From Pre-dialysis to Post-dialysis at Week 2
measure.description: Unsaturated iron-binding capacity was assessed from samples obtained pre-dialysis and post-dialysis at a single hemodialysis during study week 2. Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 2 values reflect effects of SFP in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of Placebo in the Placebo/SFP arm.
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 5 values reflect effects of Placebo in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of SFP in the Placebo/SFP arm.

group.description: Parent Study: Blinded soluble ferric pyrophosphate (SFP) 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate, then 1 week washout, then blinded standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without SFP x 2 weeks SFP: Dialysis with SFP administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate at a concentration of 2 µmoles (110 µg) iron/L of dialysate Placebo: Dialysis with standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate without iron

measure.title: Transferrin Saturation Change From Pre-dialysis to Post-dialysis at Week 5

Because of the crossover nature of the study, the week 5 values reflect effects of Placebo in the SFP/Placebo arm and effects of SFP in the Placebo/SFP arm.

outcome.title: Ferritin
outcome.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis ferritin levels were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to determine whether soluble ferric pyrophosphate increases iron stores.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

group.title: Open-label Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate
group.description: Extension Study: Open-label soluble ferric pyrophosphate administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate to yield a final dialysate concentration of 2 micromolar (110 micrograms) iron/liter.

measure.title: Ferritin
measure.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis ferritin levels were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to determine whether soluble ferric pyrophosphate increases iron stores.
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

outcome.title: Serum Iron
outcome.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis serum iron levels were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to determine the effect of soluble ferric pyrophosphate on serum iron.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

group.title: Open-label Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate
group.description: Extension Study: Open-label soluble ferric pyrophosphate administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate to yield a final dialysate concentration of 2 micromolar (110 micrograms) iron/liter.

measure.title: Serum Iron
measure.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis serum iron levels were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to determine the effect of soluble ferric pyrophosphate on serum iron.
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

outcome.title: Transferrin Saturation
outcome.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis transferrin saturation were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to confirm clearance of iron derived from soluble ferric pyrophosphate.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

group.title: Open-label Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate
group.description: Extension Study: Open-label soluble ferric pyrophosphate administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate to yield a final dialysate concentration of 2 micromolar (110 micrograms) iron/liter.

measure.title: Transferrin Saturation
measure.description: The baseline and end of treatment predialysis transferrin saturation were evaluated for the 52-week extension study to confirm clearance of iron derived from soluble ferric pyrophosphate.
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

outcome.title: Incidence of Patients Meeting Hy's Law Criteria
outcome.description: The peak alanine aminotransferase and the peak total bilirubin levels were evaluated per patient. Laboratory values for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. Patients with alanine aminotransferase more than three times the upper limit of normal and also total bilirubin more than two times the upper limit of normal are counted.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

group.title: Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate
group.description: Parent Study: Blinded soluble ferric pyrophosphate administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate to yield a final dialysate concentration of 2 micromolar (110 micrograms) iron/liter.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Parent Study: Blinded standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate

group.title: Open-label Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate
group.description: Extension Study: Open-label soluble ferric pyrophosphate administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate to yield a final dialysate concentration of 2 micromolar (110 micrograms) iron/liter.

measure.title: Incidence of Patients Meeting Hy's Law Criteria
measure.description: The peak alanine aminotransferase and the peak total bilirubin levels were evaluated per patient. Laboratory values for a given intervention (SFP or Placebo) are counted from the date of the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. Patients with alanine aminotransferase more than three times the upper limit of normal and also total bilirubin more than two times the upper limit of normal are counted.
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug (SFP or placebo, as applicable).

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 7 weeks for the Parent (Crossover) Study and up to 53 weeks for Extension Study
reported_events.desc: Adverse events for a given intervention are counted from the first day of dosing of the intervention until 7 days after the last day of dosing of the intervention. Information regarding adverse events was elicited from participants using non-leading questions at each study visit, which generally occurred 3 times per week during the study.

group.title: Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate
group.description: Parent Study: Blinded soluble ferric pyrophosphate administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate to yield a final dialysate concentration of 2 micromolar (110 micrograms) iron/liter.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Parent Study: Blinded standard liquid bicarbonate concentrate

group.title: Open-label Soluble Ferric Pyrophosphate
group.description: Extension Study: Open-label soluble ferric pyrophosphate administered via the liquid bicarbonate concentrate to yield a final dialysate concentration of 2 micromolar (110 micrograms) iron/liter.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
